test_cases.scenario: Scenario 1: Register 1 repository and confirm filter UI is displayed
test_cases.evidence: Code analysis: Line 299 condition `repositories.length > 0` evaluates to true when 1 repository exists (1 > 0 = true), causing the filter UI block (lines 299-337) to render

test_cases.scenario: Scenario 2: Confirm delete button is clickable with 1 repository
test_cases.evidence: Code analysis: Delete button (lines 323-333) is inside the filter UI block. With the condition changed to > 0, the filter UI and its delete button are accessible when 1 repository exists

test_cases.scenario: Scenario 3: Confirm repository can be deleted and reaches 0 state
test_cases.evidence: Code analysis: handleDeleteRepository function (lines 216-262) calls repositoryApi.delete() and refreshes the worktree list via fetchWorktrees(), properly handling state transitions

test_cases.scenario: Scenario 4: Confirm filter UI hides when 0 repositories
test_cases.evidence: Code analysis: Condition `repositories.length > 0` evaluates to false when 0 repositories exist (0 > 0 = false), causing the filter UI block to not render

test_cases.scenario: Scenario 5: Confirm existing multi-repository behavior is unchanged
test_cases.evidence: Code analysis: Multiple repositories (2, 3, etc.) all satisfy `> 0` condition, so filter UI continues to display as before. No other logic was modified

acceptance_criteria_status.criterion: Delete UI is accessible when only 1 repository exists
acceptance_criteria_status.verification_method: Code analysis: Changed condition from `repositories.length > 1` to `repositories.length > 0` on line 299 ensures filter UI (containing delete button) renders when 1+ repositories exist

acceptance_criteria_status.criterion: The last single repository can be deleted
acceptance_criteria_status.verification_method: Code analysis: Delete button (lines 323-333) is now accessible within the filter UI when 1 repository exists. The handleDeleteRepository function (lines 216-262) handles deletion properly

acceptance_criteria_status.criterion: Appropriate display when repository list becomes 0 after deletion
acceptance_criteria_status.verification_method: Code analysis: When repositories.length becomes 0, condition `> 0` is false, filter UI hides. Empty state message on lines 420-438 displays 'No worktrees found' appropriately

acceptance_criteria_status.criterion: No impact on existing multi-repository behavior
acceptance_criteria_status.verification_method: Code analysis: Changing from `> 1` to `> 0` is a superset condition. All values that satisfied `> 1` also satisfy `> 0`, so existing multi-repository behavior is preserved

build_result.output: Compiled successfully, no type errors, 12 static pages generated

message: All acceptance criteria have been verified through code analysis and build verification. The implementation change correctly fixes the issue where the delete UI was inaccessible when only 1 repository existed.
